title: RTX 5060 Ti 8GB drops to $299, making it worth buying for the first time — get a big slice of Blackwell power for the same price as an RTX 5060
summary: The Gigabyte GeForce RTX 5060 Ti WindForce Max OC 8G goes on sale for $299.99, 23% off its regular price.

title: Nvidia’s TiDAR experiment could speed up AI token generation using hybrid diffusion decoder — new research boasts big throughput gains, but limitations remain
summary: Nvidia has released a paper describing TiDAR, a decoding method that merges two historically separate approaches to accelerating language model inference.

title: Samsung touts 96% lower-power NAND design — researchers investigate design based on ferroelectric transistors
summary: Samsung researchers have published a detailed account of an experimental NAND architecture that aims to cut one of the technology’s largest power drains by as much as 96%.

title: We put together an $1800 all-AMD 4K gaming PC built entirely from Cyber Monday deals — but we can't match this Alienware pre-built with a 5080 and Intel's Core Ultra
summary: We built an $1,800 gaming PC capable of 4K gaming using parts only on sale during the Cyber Monday sales event.

title: Nvidia's RTX 5090 Founders Edition just got restocked in the UK, undercuts AIB cards by over £200 — GPU available directly from Nvidia marketplace
summary: Nvidia's hugely popular RTX 5090 Founders Edition has been restocked in the UK at its MSRP price of £1,799. This card is not restocked very often, which makes it a minor miracle that Nvidia has magically found some behind its data center-shaped sofa in time for Cyber Monday.

title: Seagate's 24TB BarraCuda is back in stock for just $0.01 per gigabyte — the storage steal of the weekend returns, still great value
summary: Seagate's monster 24TB BarraCuda hard drive is back on sale for nearly the same price that we last saw it at. The 7200RPM high-capacity champ is on sale for $260 at Newegg.

title: The RAM pricing crisis has only just started, Team Group GM warns — says problem will get worse in 2026 as DRAM and NAND prices double in one month
summary: The diversion of DRAM capacity into HBM for AI has already doubled memory prices, pushed DDR5 above $27 per 16 Gb, and, according to Gerry Chen of TeamGroup, will leave the market short through at least 2027–2028 as new fabs come too late to relieve supply.

title: Our favorite budget headset is now half price — get the HyperX Cloud III for just $49 at Walmart
summary: The HyperX Cloud III, already our top budget gaming headset pick for its comfort, clean sound, and cross-platform support, is now available for its lowest price ever at Walmart.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
summary: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.

title: Ridley Scott's masterful epic of betrayal and vengeance
summary: Maximus Decimus Meridius, favoured general of the Roman emperor, is betrayed and enslaved.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: What next for friendly foes who see each other 'more than family'?
summary: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz have dominated men’s tennis in 2025. BBC Sport looks at the evolution of their growing rivalry – and where it could go next.

title: 'It felt like God's hand on my brain' - the day England were humbled by teenager
summary: BBC Sport's From The Ashes series concludes with the inside story of Ashton Agar's record-breaking introduction to Test cricket as a 19-year-old batting at number 11.

title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
summary: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

title: 'I deeply hurt people by moving to Saudi Arabia'
summary: In an interview with BBC Sport, Ashleigh Plumptre says she regrets losing the trust of some LGBT fans in women's football by moving to Saudi Arabia.
